featured.text: When a person takes a polygraph test, four to six wires, called sensors, are 22 to different parts of his body.
The sensors pick up signals from the person’s blood pressure, pulse, and perspiration.
Today, attachments include radios, sensors, cameras, and a lot more.

definition.zh_def: 感測器，一種能夠檢測物理量並將其轉換為可讀取信號的裝置。
definition.en_def: A device that detects physical properties and converts them into a readable signal.
definition.example: The smoke sensor alerted us to the fire in the building.
